ResearchTopics.Overview: These are topics that might be useful foci for the initial research session at the beginning of the module.

Topic.name: AI Coding Assistants: Current State of the Industry
Topic.SubTopic: - e.g. Claude Code - How do they work? What workflows do they support?
- e.g. Cursor IDE, GitHub Copilot - What features do they offer?
- e.g. OpenAI Codex - What are the advantages of web-based tools?
- What other types of AI coding assistants exist? - What gaps might there be in the market?

Topic.name: AI API Usage: Effective Prompt Strategies
Topic.SubTopic: - Getting good outputs from code models - Getting code vs. explanations – how to structure prompts differently - Examples of effective prompts for different code tasks
- What are system prompts and how do they differ from user prompts? - Best practices for system prompts in coding contexts - How to use system prompts to constrain or guide model behavior

Topic.name: AI API Usage: Limitations & Mitigations (Anthropic, Google & OpenAI)
Topic.SubTopic: - What are the context window limits for different models? - How to fit large codebases or files within token limits - Strategies for chunking or summarizing code
- What rate limits do different APIs have? - How to handle rate limiting in your application
- Cost comparison between different API providers - How to estimate costs for your use case - Strategies to minimize API costs

Topic.name: AI API Usage: Features & Methods (Anthropic, Google & OpenAI)
Topic.SubTopic: - How to implement streaming for better UX - When to use streaming vs. waiting for complete responses
- How to get JSON or other structured data from models - Using function calling or schema-guided generation
- What is temperature and how does it affect outputs? - Optimal temperature settings for code generation
- What is CoT and why is it useful? - How to prompt for step-by-step reasoning
- Overview of function calling capabilities - How models can request to use tools or APIs

Topic.name: Security & Ethics
Topic.SubTopic: - Potential bias in AI-generated code - Are there biases in how models approach problems? - How to recognize and mitigate bias - Licensing issues - What license does AI-generated code have? - Copyright concerns with training data - Plagiarism issues - Can AI reproduce copyrighted code? - How to verify originality of generated code
- Risks of sending proprietary code to external APIs - Data retention policies of different API providers - Best practices for secure API usage - When to use self-hosted models instead

Topic.name: AI in CI/CD & DevOps
Topic.SubTopic: - Example: Arm's extension for Copilot uses GitHub Actions to integrate AI into the CI pipeline - Example: GitHub's example of Copilot auto-generating PRs via Actions - What are companies doing with AI in their CI/CD pipelines?

- How to create custom actions - JavaScript action vs Docker action – what are the trade-offs? - How workflows are triggered (on push, on PR, on schedule, etc.) - Examples of existing AI-related actions in the marketplace

Topic.name: Approaches & Tools for Using AI
Topic.SubTopic: - What are these frameworks and what do they offer? - When to use a framework vs. calling APIs directly
- Breaking complex tasks into multiple prompts - How to chain outputs from one prompt as inputs to another
- What is RAG and why is it useful? - High-level overview of how it works
- What are embeddings? - How to use embeddings for code search or similarity
